summary: This document is a chain of emails between federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and defense attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, providing case information, and negotiating a potential voluntary interview for a client, while revealing the existence of cell phone records linking the client to underage girls.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: She is an associate attorney working with Suzanne Jaffe Bloom, corresponding with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings and confirm details regarding a grand jury subpoena and a potential client interview.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: She is the lead defense attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena from the SDNY. She communicates with prosecutors to schedule meetings, confirm representation, and discuss evidence, including cell phone records.

connections.description: They are both attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of a client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Bloom is confirmed as the formally retained attorney for a client who received a grand jury subpoena, and she is negotiating a potential voluntary interview on their behalf.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to an individual, prompting the legal correspondence.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The initial date the subpoenaed individual was to appear before the grand jury, which was adjourned and held in abeyance.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: A meeting is proposed between the defense attorneys (Bloom and Hudgens) and the SDNY prosecution team.

locations: Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Winston & Strawn LLP, 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an individual represented by attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom.
Prosecutors possess contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to Bloom's client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls.
The prosecution and defense were negotiating a potential voluntary interview with the client, leading to the adjournment of the initial grand jury appearance date of July 24, 2019.
The correspondence confirms the formal attorney-client relationship between Suzanne Jaffe Bloom and the subpoenaed individual.
Prosecutors provided the defense with docket numbers for related civil cases and an example of a standard proffer agreement.
